bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 17, 1939

div1.p: Hench expresses appreciation for Kean's collaboration in preparing the story of the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 17, 1939
div1.opener:
Yellow fever
November 17, 1939
General J. R. Kean
2804 N. Street N.W.
Georgetown
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Kean:
div1.p:
I appreciate as very much your letter to me express-
ing your willingness to help in the preparation of the story
of the yellow fever experiments. It will not be possible for
me to come to Washington until some time in the early Spring.
In the meantime, I shall take the liberty of making out some
sort of a questionnaire which you can perhaps consider at
your leisure. The chance of having your collaboration and of
having at hand the wonderfully valuable material which you
must have, makes me indeed happy. I hope to visit Moran
in Havana in March.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
